TRIALS FOR NEWLY PUBLISHED PROCEDURES. RNAV STARS RNP APPROACH (REF AIP GREECE, AD2-LGAV-IAC-22,25) WILL BE AVAILABLE TO SUITABLY EQUIPPED AIRCRAFT. DURING THIS PERIOD, CLEARANCE FOR A RELEVANT PBN PROCEDURE TO ANY RELEVANT FLIGHT MAY BE INITIATED BY ATC WITHOUT THE PREVIOUSLY ESTABLISHED CONCURRENCE OF THE FLIGHT CREW. THE RESPECTIVE READBACK OF THE SAID PROCEDURE WILL MEAN THAT THE FLIGHT IS SUITABLY EQUIPPED AND CERTIFIED FOR ITS EXECUTION. INVERSELY, IN THE CASE OF INABILITY TO EXECUTE THE SAID PROCEDURE, THE FLIGHT CREW ARE EXPECTED TO USE THE APPROPRIATE PHRASEOLOGY TO INFORM ATC OF THIS INABILITY AND OF THE REASONS. THE CONTROLLER WILL THEN ISSUE SUITABLE ALTERNATIVE INSTRUCTIONS. NORMAL SEPARATION SHALL BE PROVIDED BETWEEN ALL FLIGHTS CLEARED TO EXECUTE A PBN PROCEDURE (STAR, SID OR IAP) AND ALL OTHER IFR FLIGHTS. ALL COMMENTS CONDUCIVE TO THE SAFE AND OTHERWISE EFFICIENT FURTHER IMPLEMENTATION OF PBN PROCEDURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE MAILED TO DAAEKB(AT)HASP.GOV.GR.

-LOCAL PRE-TRIAL A-CDM OPERATIONAL PROCEDURES ARE IN FORCE AT AIRPORT. -GROUND HANDLER (GH) ARE TO REPORT AND UPDATE TOBT (TARGET OFF- BLOCK TIME). -TSAT (TARGET START-UP APPROVAL TIME) WILL BE COMMUNICATED TO AIRSPACE USER BY GROUND HANDLER (GH). -WHERE A-VDGS (ADVANCED VISUAL DOCKING GUIDANCE SYSTEM) IS AVAILABLE TOBT AND TSAT WILL BE DISPLAYED. -THE PILOT SHALL REQUEST AN UPDATE TO THE TOBT FROM THE GROUND HANDLER (GH) IF THE TOBT CANNOT BE MET AT ANY MOMENT. -THE PILOT SHALL ENSURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT WILL BE READY FOR START UP CLEARANCE AND WILL HAVE CONTACT ON THE DELIVERY FREQUENCY WITHIN THE TSAT WINDOW (+/-5 MINS). -DEPARTURE CLEARANCE (EXCEPT SQUAWK) SHALL BE AVAILABLE 18 MINUTES BEFORE EOBT OR LATER. - THE PILOT SHALL CONTACT GROUND CONTROL FOR PUSH BACK OR TAXI WITHIN 5 MIN FROM OBTAINING START UP CLEARANCE (ASAT). - IF NO PUSH BACK OR TAXI REQUESTED AT ASAT+5, TSAT WILL EXPIRE, AND A NEW TOBT WILL BE REQUIRED FOR THE FLIGHT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE DEPARTURE SEQUENCE AND RECEIVE A NEW TSAT. -PUSH AND HOLD PROCEDURES WILL BE USED TO AVOID HOLDING ARRIVING AIRCRAFT IN CASE OF OCCUPIED STANDS.

ADS-B DATA FOR ADVANCED TOWER TRIAL OPERATIONS. 1.1 IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIROPRT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR TRIALS OF THE ADVANCED ATC TOWER PROJECT AT KAVALA AIRPORT, PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL A) SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MORE A CODE OR B) IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASIIGNED MODE A CODE -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2 WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E CALL SIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3 AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP AND SOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

ALL PROPELLER AIRCRAFTS MUST ENTER AND LEAVE PARKING STANDS UNDER THEIR OWN POWER FOLLOWING MARSHALLERS INSTRUCTIONS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED BY ATC. FOR SAFETY REASONS USE MINIMUM ENGINE POWER DURING TAXIING OUT FROM THE STAND.

Paragraph.Text: AX0002/20 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR THE PILOT OF THE AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN THE LIBYAN AIR SPACE A. THE LIBYAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY STRESSES THE PILOT OF AIRCRAFT OPERATING OUTSIDE THE FIELD OF HIGH COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE NECESSITY OF USING VHF/ RT RANGE .RADIO FREQUENCY ASSIGNED TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BETWEEN PILOTS VHF AIR / AIR VOLINTARY REPORT. B. FOR MORE COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPPOSING AIR TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY THOSE OPERATING OUTSIDE THE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION IN THE LIBYAN AVIATION TERRITORY AND THE MENTIONED RADIO FREQUENCIES ARE: 1- WHEN FLYING AT OR BELOW THE FLYING LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 123.5 MHZ 2- WHEN FLYING ABOVE A FLIGHT LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 126.9 MHZ C. THIS AUTHORITY ALSO STRESSES THE NEED TO OBTAIN PRIOR PERMISSION FOR FLIGHTS BEFORE TAKING OFF FROM AIRPORTS THAT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THE MAJOR AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTERS IN TRIPOLI AND ITS BRANCH IN BENGHAZI BY WAY OF HIGH-FREQUENCY RADIO
